pros: everything about working here was a pro....free food and shirts....you pick you availability.
cons: there really were no cons.

pros: The people and the students are great
cons: The pay is low for the work that is expected

pros: Had a great community Worked with my class schedule Really supportive of our outside projects
cons: Limited staff No specific office space

pros: Flexible work environment Accommodating schedule Good benefits/perks both from the school and the state Depending on the department, there is the ability to move up
cons: The pay is HORRIBLE. This point cannot be stressed enough Each department has cliques and plenty of campus gossip Depending on the department, there is no room to advance Management lacks strength and is very reactive verse proactive Staff is often expected to volunteer for events. If you don't volunteer, you will be "voluntold"

pros: My environment was great in my department. I haven't met a GA that didn't like their department. We get half off on our tuition during the Spring and Fall semesters along with a $6,000 stipend annually for 20 hours of work a week. Student Life has a lot of fun positions.
cons: I know of some GA that work over 20 hours a week. Some are GA for sports teams and spend lots of time coaching and recruiting off campus. So, if you don't want to work overtime I wouldn't work in that department.

pros: Great environment with fun and intelligent coworkers. Work is not too hard. You can do homework in frequent downtimes. Flexible schedule.
cons: You have to deal with some unpleasant students/parents, but only 1 or 2 a day.

job_title: Writing Center Tutor in Greenwood, SC
pros: Landed my first job out of college from working here before even graduating. Looks great on my resume. Great opportunity to set yourself up for success after graduation.
cons: Not enough hours available to be significant source of income, but I think that most people get involved because of the awesome opportunities you get from being involved.

pros: Work life balance Retirement Environment
cons: Management Stress People Students Pay for some

review_title: Good job if you like teaching
pros:
Good resumé builder
Fun to do
cons:
Low pay
Inconsistent schedule
Lots of cancelled appointments

job_title: Academic Success Center in Greenwood, SC
pros: Great fellow staff members, work environment and supervision. Opportunity to make a great impact on students.
cons: Low salaries, lack of software system to help with advising and student success, high expectations and not much downtime - there is always something we are supporting - advising, registration, early alerts, probation, SAP appeals, suspension appeals, student follow ups, orientation, success workshops, testing, etc.

pros: Friendly staff, great students, good benefits.
cons: Currently the focus is to get as many students through the door as possible and then figure out infrastructure and processes later. This creates avoidable operational stresses.

pros: The team I worked with felt like a family. We got our jobs done, but always had time to connect with one another. The culture was the best part, and something I haven't been able to find anywhere else. My job as an Admissions Counselor taught me many foundational skills that propelled me into my professional career.
cons: The lack of upward mobility.

pros: Collaborative work environment and supportive administration. An up and coming state University in South Carolina.
cons: Not specifically a con but, must be willing to work in a rural/small town setting.

pros: Great team environment and a lot of hands on work. Staff gives a lot of creative freedom when it comes to class ideas and programs.
cons: Not really any opportunities to move up. Older staff members are not always willing to share class materials or ideas.

job_title: Men's Assistant Basketball Coach in Salem, OR
pros:
Great Staff to work for 
Great Facilities, some of the best in the conference 
The Peach Belt Great Conference 
Great people
cons: Loved my job so there were no Cons

job_title: Student Success Advisor in Greenwood, SC
pros: Flexible hours, small university, ability to work independently
cons: Sometimes unorganized, not much room for advancement

pros: Flexibility. Will work around class schedule.
cons: Not the best pay, but it is worth it.

pros: All good and there is nothing bad
cons: Nothing wrong in the slightest

job_title: Assistant Director of Housing in Greenwood, SC
pros:
- comp time
- annual leave
-sick leave
cons:
- no work life balance 
- stressful situations

pros: Flexible schedules and allowed to complete work while on the job
cons: Limited hours due to being a student employee but could get 20/week

job_title: Visiting Assistant Professor in Greenwood, SC
pros:
Very helpful department  and caring colleagues.   Opportunities for long-term, stable employment.  Most faculty that I have interacted with really care about the students and one another.

Inexpensive cost of living in Greenwood.
cons:
Faculty are underpaid and undervalued by the administration.

Lack of admissions standards leads to many students that have little ambition.  This is especially prevalent in freshman courses where students expect grades to be handed to them.  

Small endowment and little funds to continue professional development or access scholarly resources.

review_title: Overall, a great environment to work in with very little stress
pros: Flex scheduling is allowed at your supervisor's discretion.  Accrued 3 weeks of annual leave a year and recognizes every holiday you can think of.  Stable work environment.
cons: Budget struggles result in very few raises and when a raise is given, it's usually 2-4% which is usually offset by an increase in insurance.  No much room for career advancement.

pros: Being a tutor was probably one of the best things I could have ever done.  I loved helping students learn and was comforted by the fact that my peers were getting the attention they needed in an environment where there was no pressure.  It was great!
cons: You weren't guaranteed appointments.  If the kids didn't make appointments with you, you had no hours, and thus no pay.  That was the only downfall of this job.

job_title: Communications Specialist I in Greenwood, SC
pros: I get to be the person behind the scene that helps people out even though I'm not physically there. I the one who makes a difference how fast things can get done and the officers can get there. Being able to help the students and faculty and staff only the daily bases is an awesome feeling.
cons: Being able to as a Communications Specialist is a different thing than I thought but there really aren't any cons about the job.

review_title: So grateful to be a part of an organization that really cares about you!!
pros:
-They are completely understanding. Say you are sick one day, they really help you so you won't be swamped with work the day you return
-So friendly 
-So helpful to people who come into the office for help 
-Increased responsibility with hard work 
-During the summer, you get Friday's off!
cons: -Students can often be needy and don't read instructions that you give them

pros: Friendly co-workers, flexible scheduling depending on workload that week, quite easy work, much appreciated benefits such as snacks and drinks
cons: Very low pay in comparison to other institutions, students are often times very unmotivated and tiring to work with, location of University is very rural

pros:
Wonderful students.
Safe place to live and raise a family. 
Inexpensive housing. 
Open to technology.
cons:
No strategic planners.
President is not a fund raiser. 
Faculty have been programmed to say yes to everything. 
Endowment is low.

pros: Management knows that life is unpredictable and they are very flexible.
cons: Some software programs are outdated and need upgraded.

review_title: One of the greatest experiences I have had in life.
job_title: Resident Assistant, Peer Tutor, Teacher Assistant in Greenwood, SC
pros: The campus is small enough to feel "at home" but large enough to meet new people, daily.
cons: The only con is the fact that I did not have more time here.

pros: Slow paced environment, so if you are lazy this place is pretty laid back
cons: No real financial support for professional development
